description: In Indian-controlled Kashmir, residents are voting in elections that some hope will lead to restoration of the territory's statehood, which ended when it became a federally governed territory in 2019.
title: In Kashmir, voting begins in first local elections since India revoked autonomy

description:
Life is uncertain for children in war zones. There, school can be a source of stability or just another thing that war obliterates. We hear reports on what school is like in three of the world's most active war zones: Sudan, Gaza and Ukraine.

Sign up for State of the World+ to listen sponsor-free and support the work of NPR journalists. Visit plus.npr.org.
title: What is School Like for Children in War Zones?

description: Souther was a prolific songwriter and musician who helped shape the country-rock sound that took root in Southern California in the 1970s with his collaborations with the Eagles and Linda Ronstadt.
title: JD Souther, who collaborated on 'Heartache Tonight' and other Eagles hits, dies at 78

description: This Shanghai bookstore, now in D.C., was revived by its owner, who hopes to create a space for open discussions in the diaspora community, where people can sit and read together.
title: A bookstore too controversial for China finds home in D.C.

description: Tupperware's reliance on people selling its storage containers at home-and-garden parties or through social media was once its strength. Now it's a weakness, the company says in its bankruptcy filing.
title: Tupperware, no longer a kitchen staple, files for bankruptcy

description: American cyclist Lael Wilcox rode more than 18,000 miles in 108 days, 12 hours and 12 minutes. She's claiming the record for the fastest woman to ride around the world.
title: Lael Wilcox rode around the world and then went for another bike ride

description: Georgia election officials have said they are “gravely concerned that dramatic changes” approved by the State Election Board “will disrupt the preparation and training processes already in motion.”
title: Georgia election officials worry a GOP-led board will OK last-minute voting changes

description: A baby pygmy hippopotamus in a Thailand zoo has become a worldwide internet sensation, leading to crowds at the zoo. Zoo officials say the increased attention has led to some bad visitor behavior.
title: Meet Moo Deng, the baby pygmy hippo so popular you can visit her for only 5 minutes

description: Hundreds of costumed "Helens" are cheerfully invading bars across the country in honor of Helen Roper, from the 1970s sitcom Three's Company.
title: See a loopy landlady in a caftan? Mrs. Roper may be romping through your town

description: New research from Gallup and Workhuman finds that employees who receive recognition on the job are 45% less likely to leave their jobs. Younger workers, in particular, say appreciation is key.
title: Want to keep good workers? Praise them, a new study finds

description: The FBI and the U.S. Postal Service were investigating the origin of suspicious packages that have been sent to elections officials in more than 15 states. There were no immediate reports of injuries.
title: The FBI is investigating packages sent to election officials in more than 15 states

description: A new report shows rapid development of new cancer treatment and detection is helping people live more. But more people are also getting diagnosed, and at younger ages.
title: Report: Cancer diagnoses are more common but so is surviving
